problems.title: Left Rotation Operation (Simple Understanding)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Understand how a LEFT ROTATION works in an AVL Tree.
You will be given exactly TWO values.
Insert both values into a normal BST (no balancing).
Then perform a LEFT ROTATION on the root and print the new root's value.

Left Rotation (Simple)
If a node X becomes right-heavy:

      X                     Y
       \       --->        / \
        Y                 X   R

After rotation, Y becomes new root.

Input Format
Two space-separated integers A and B.
(They will always be in increasing order so rotation is easy.)

Output Format
Print:
root: V
Where V is the root value AFTER left rotation.

Example
Input:
10 20

BST before rotation:
   10
     \
      20

After left rotation:
   20
  /
10

Output:
root: 20
problems.examples:
Sample Input 1
10 20

Sample Output 1
root: 20

Sample Input 2
5 9

Sample Output 2
root: 9
problems.constraints:
Two integers A < B
1 ≤ A, B ≤ 10^6
hintsList: Draw the rotation diagram: X becomes left child of Y.
After rotation, the right child becomes the new root.
